ygData.subject: Re: Lab 5 (Malice/Wolfblade)
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, heating something to about 3000 degrees requires a lot of energy, a lot more to do it twice.  I d pay big money to see you do the same thing.  So, do

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

"Well, heating something to about 3000 degrees requires a lot of energy, a lot more to do it twice.  I'd pay big money to see you do the same thing.  So, do you want to get to work on the repulser first or..." he paused for another yawn, then finished"...or take a quick nap?" 

 
OOC- That was lightning fast!  No one has responded to something that quickly in a while!  Sweet!
shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@...> wrote:
WOlfblade::

"Your tired? the one bot that can pull energy from thin air? Your 
tired?"  She smirked, "Never thought I'd ever hear those words be 
uttered from your face plates."


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> "Exiting the atmosphere is no problem.  Maybe we can rig a repulser 
field to push it out there.  I'm sure we can reconfigure the main 
tractor emitter to suit our purposes."
> Malice took the generator and check the hole in the sphere for 
size.  It would fit, so he fit it inside and plugged it up with the 
cross section he cut.  He used the sword to seal the hole and the 
sphere itself was ready.
> "I'm tired.  I use a bunch of energy cutting on this thing."
> He let a yawn escape, and rested his weight against the sphere.
>  
> OOC- You're back!  Yeah!  Remember, beat up your boss!  He can't do 
that to you!

"In the name of God, I banish these souls of the evil undead into damnation.  May God have mercy, for I have none.  In Jesus' Holy Name, Amen." -Rawl, Hellsing-RPG
